author: Andrew Graybill
title: ‘The Last Cowboys’ Review: Giving Good Rein
text: In 1983, country singer George Strait scored a major hit with a cover of the modern ballad “Amarillo by Morning.” The lyrics describe life on the rodeo circuit: overnight drives to the next stop, bones broken by falls from the saddle and relationships fractured by distance. But the song ends on an upbeat note, with the singer crooning, “I ain’t got a dime but what I got is mine; / I ain’t rich, but Lord I’m free.” A tidy encapsulation of 150 years of cowboy mythology, “Amarillo by Morning” celebrates the lone man on horseback:...
